alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 8:29AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Boyd, south central Greenup, Lawrence, southeastern Carter, southeastern Lawrence, Cabell and northern Wayne Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 828 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms near Beech Fork State Park, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water problems could be possible. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Grayson, Louisa, Coal Grove, Wayne, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Barboursville, Kenova, Milton, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Fort Gay and Coalton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 171 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
